repnme.cdata!:
Energy matters : achieving secure and clean
            energy in Latin America and the Caribbean

abstracts.cdata!:
Successful economic and social
            development in Latin America and the Caribbean, as in other
            regions, hinges upon the availability of reliable and
            affordable energy supplies. IBRD is working with governments
            and the private sector throughout Latin America and the
            Caribbean to help connect more people and businesses to
            modern energy supplies that are supplied and consumed
            efficiently and are increasingly environmentally-friendly.

docna.cdata!:
Energy matters : achieving secure and clean
            energy in Latin America and the Caribbean

display_title.display_title:
Energy matters : achieving secure
            and clean energy in Latin America and the Caribbean

repnme.cdata!:
Latin America and the Caribbean - Region
            eyes lower carbon development path

abstracts.cdata!:
This Result Profile talks about Latin
            America and the Caribbean energy. Successful economic and
            social development in Latin America and the Caribbean hinges
            on the availability of reliable and affordable energy
            supplies. Development of domestic energy resources was
            deemed critical in oil-importing countries, notably
            renewable resources, such as hydro, wind and solar power. In
            Mexico, International Bank for Reconstruction and
            Development (IBRD) combined development policy lending,
            investment lending and in-depth analytic work to help
            develop the country’s substantial renewable energy
            potential. IBRD was helping to provide new electricity
            access to an estimated 500,000 rural people by the end of
            2011. Two studies on lower-carbon development in Brazil and
            Mexico raised awareness using highly participative
            approaches involving multiple high-level consultations with
            ministries and public agencies. Mexico Efficient Lighting
            and Appliances Project enhanced the country’s energy
            security by increasing efficient use of energy and
            supporting its efforts to mitigate climate change.
            Electrobras Distribution Rehabilitation Project improved the
            financial and operational performance and the commercial
            management of six Eletrobrás-managed Distribution Companies
            in Brazil by reducing electricity losses, increasing bill
            collection rate, and increasing quality of service. The IBRD
            was working with governments and the private sector
            throughout the region to connect more people and businesses
            to efficient and environmentally friendly modern energy.

docna.cdata!:
Latin America and the Caribbean - Region
            eyes lower carbon development path

            Region eyes lower carbon development path

repnme.cdata!:
Latin America and the Caribbean - Region
            eyes lower carbon development path

abstracts.cdata!:
This Result Profile talks about Latin
            America and the Caribbean energy. Successful economic and
            social development in Latin America and the Caribbean hinges
            on the availability of reliable and affordable energy
            supplies. Development of domestic energy resources was
            deemed critical in oil-importing countries, notably
            renewable resources, such as hydro, wind and solar power. In
            Mexico, International Bank for Reconstruction and
            Development (IBRD) combined development policy lending,
            investment lending and in-depth analytic work to help
            develop the country’s substantial renewable energy
            potential. IBRD was helping to provide new electricity
            access to an estimated 500,000 rural people by the end of
            2011. Two studies on lower-carbon development in Brazil and
            Mexico raised awareness using highly participative
            approaches involving multiple high-level consultations with
            ministries and public agencies. Mexico Efficient Lighting
            and Appliances Project enhanced the country’s energy
            security by increasing efficient use of energy and
            supporting its efforts to mitigate climate change.
            Electrobras Distribution Rehabilitation Project improved the
            financial and operational performance and the commercial
            management of six Eletrobrás-managed Distribution Companies
            in Brazil by reducing electricity losses, increasing bill
            collection rate, and increasing quality of service. The IBRD
            was working with governments and the private sector
            throughout the region to connect more people and businesses
            to efficient and environmentally friendly modern energy.
